Review text:
Discovered that a drop or two of light oil (I’m using coconut oil which is kind to the skin) will solve the noise problems.

About 90-95% of the clippings are trapped in the compartment, which is a good thing.

Not the easiest cutter to clean, but removing and rinsing the plastic parts helps.

I wish the whole trimmer was waterproof.

Battery life is good.

Overall this is adequate and I expect it to last more than 3 years as a weekly beard and hair trimmer.

Review text:
The Remington does not feel like a premium product.

It’s clunky and full of hard plastics that looks terrible.

But the vacuum and canister is nice to empty.

To be honest, the Pana didn’t immediately strike me as a premium product, either but compared to them Remington you appreciate the lack of fake stainless steel and hard-touch plastics everywhere.

The Pana rests nicely in the palm, too, and I’ve come to like the understated nature of it.

Review text:
Powered by a lithium battery, this cordless trimmer charges quickly and provides nearly an hour and a half runtime per full charge.  

There are 11 length settings and they are easy to set using a sliding mechanism and an easy to engage lock (plastic).  

There is also a precision trimmer for those really stylish, artistic beards.  

This trimmer works well, particularly on longer, fuller beards, although its less useful for the short, five oclock shadow type beards.

Review text:
"No length adjustment settings for 7, 9, 11 mm?

What?

I think those are the numbers that are missing - the blade guard wont lock in, theres no number there.

Ridiculous.

Not to mention, if you wear glasses, youll need those plus a magnifying glass to even see the microscript number settings.

Its clunky to hold, fell out of my hands five times, and I was being conscious of the poor design shape, trying to hold it firmly -

yeah, right.

Review text:
Some of the other brands have the cutting head held on by small plastic clips on the side and they break off easily.

This Remington does not have those side clips and the vacuum on this unit is excellent plus easy to clean.

Cuts evenly.

You do need to put the length adjustment on the shaver before each use and the setting for your length of beard is something you need to experiment with starting at a longer setting.

Would recommend this trimmer.

Review text: Nicely balanced. Great battery, feels solid. Nice vacuum feature. Quiet operation. Beard trimmer depth guide is incredibly poorly designed. Only one side attaches to trimmer body. The more you raise the guide for greater length of trimming, the less stable the guide is. Flexes easily meaning depth/height changes. In addition, the lock control to change adjustments is terrible. Hard to accurately move especially up for longer length. Final very poor design issue is it is nearly impossible to use the guide in a tight situation such as to trim mustache under your nose. I will say for just trimming the open face for sort length setting, it works great. I would just like to talk to the clean shaven engineer who designed this. The other strange thing is I’m replacing a decade or so old Remington trimmer MB-400 that is so far superior to this one—why did they ever discontinue it??

This is a great product in my opinion and I am glad to have it in our home.

Review text: "  On paper, this trimmer seems like a great idea. In reality, it doesnt quite live up to expectations. Physically, this is large, cumbersome, heavy, and feels more like a baton in your hand than it should. It is also loud. Very loud (more on this later). The overall build quality feels nice. It certainly feels solid and well made. However, that is where the positives on the physical size and shape end. Because of its overall size, it can be awkward to maneuver with and get into tight spaces like under your nose if you were to trim in a downward direction. The integrated adjustable comb is a nice feature, but on this, the adjustment is fiddly and binds up at times. This wouldnt be too much of an issue, but in order to switch the heads, you need to take it completely off first. That reason combined with the overall bulk would make me want to get a second detail trimmer.", The overall cutting performance is ok. I have used better as well as much worse. The blades don't cut extremely fast so you do need to trim at a slower pace to avoid grabbing. Other than this, it kind of just works. The battery life is decent as well. Trimming three or four times a week you shouldn't need to charge it more than once in that time. The charging time isnt especially fast, but with the battery capacity, this isn't too much of a concern. However, the main disappointment of this trimmer is also its primary feature, the vacuum system. It just doesn't work as well as it needs to in order to justify its existence. It doesn't really "suck" hair inside as much as it kind of falls in there with a bit of help from a suction. Unless the opening for hair to go in is directly below the cutting surface, not a whole lot goes in. For people like myself who need to trim my neck at different angles, this feature adds nothing. I still have a bunch of hair to clean up when I'm done. I should also mention that this only works at all when you are trimming the hair by a small amount. If I attempted to trim even a week's worth of growth, it is completely useless. The vacuum system wouldnt be nearly as annoying if you could turn it off. You cant. Because you have no choice but to have it running this trimmer is extremely loud. That being said, it does have some good aspects. Opening the trimmer to clean out the hair is quick and easy., "Overall, this isnt a bad trimmer. For some people, it might even be amazing. I am just not one of them. If you are the type of person who is ok with trimming several times a week and your hair doesnt grow in different directions so the hair is able to be collected well by the vacuum, I would easily recommend this to you."

Guard blade has standard trim sizes, but I have to switch to the smaller blade attachment without using any guard to get the hairs just below my nose/upper lip area. Review text: I was skeptical about the vacuum function but I have to say, it catches a lot of hair., "Ive been using this for weeks now so that I could get a good understanding of how well every thing works. I hate using something once or twice and then writing a review, there is no way I could possibly provide the good and bad without missing something if I rushed the review.", "Using it is pretty straight forward, if youve used any kind of a similar device youll feel comfortable here. The included second side burn trimmer head is adequate for a number of different applications as well.", "I had my wife give me a brush cut with it and the result was great. It was while getting the brush cut that we were able to see just how much the vacuum collected. Yes it fills quickly when doing this but its also simple to open up and dispose of the collected hairs. When trimming the beard there is a small amount of clean up on the bathroom counter but far less than with other trimmers.", The comb is adjustable by depressing a button and then sliding it up or down but in order to open the vacuum chamber you have to first of all completely remove the comb. This is a bit of a pain. The comb is attached only on the back with this sliding section, this means the front can be slightly depressed causing hairs to be trimmed at a different length so a light touch is needed in order to get all hairs the same length., "The rechargeable batteries last a long time, in three weeks I havent had to recharge yet. The trimmer has been used at least every second day so battery life is excellent.", "✓ One thing I was expecting when first looking at it was a lot of vibration as the vacuum vanes are large. In fact its hard to tell that there is a spinning collector fan, everything is well balanced."

Review text: "  I absolutely love these trimmers. I have a nice Wahl set Ive been using for the past eight years; heres how they compare.", "1. Both have lithium ion batteries. This is great. Any Ni Cad batteries still being put in consumer products like this is a travesty. Lithium Ion batteries charge fast and dont have any memory effect or other peculiarities that force you to charge according to a regimented schedule or risk ruining the battery. Ni Cad, you should have disappeared from the world 20 years ago.", "2. The Phillips set has two beard combs, but you only need to pick one, generally long or generally short, and then you can dial in the exact length to want on the unit itself. This is much more convenient, easier to store and more precise, than juggling the half dozen guard combs that come with the Wahl unit. On the Philips, there is a set of illuminated numbers that tell you at a glance exactly what length you have dialed in. Do you like it shorter on the sides, or do you like to use several different lengths? So easy with this system. The comb stays on... just turn the dial. Its difficult to overstate how amazing this is... its a game changer.", 3. The Philips can be rinsed under the tap. The blade can. Snap off the blade before doing this. The blade on the Wahl is screwed on., "4. The Philips cannot be used to trim hair inside the ear or nostrils. Not unless youre some kind of sideshow performer, because there are no attachments for this. The Wahl has these.", "5. The construction of both is above average. The Wahl has lasted a long time. I hope the Philips does too. The Wahl requires that oil be placed on the blades occasionally. The Philips says nothing about oil. I hope that means it doesnt need it, not that it does but doesnt tell you. Its one less thing to have to worry about maintaining. The Philips is built more like a Philips appliance than a Norelco appliance. No offense to Norelco, but they have a bad name around here for some of the terrible products theyve fobbed off on an unsuspecting public during the last century. Philips has usually been solid. Maybe them buying Norelco has changed things.", "I trimmed my beard tonight with the Philps and it looks great. Its so easy to use, not switching combs and dialing in the lengths I want on the fly. Im quite happy."

Im using a zip-loc Baggie for them."

Review text: When I received this Philips Norelco trimmer, it looked plain, unimpressive and just like any other trimmer I’ve had before from the different major brands out there. I’d been having issues with a AA battery powered trimmer, and another one that runs on lithium battery! Tugging and snagging on my hairs – I had stopped using them but they stay there in my bathroom because they still looked good and they still powered on strongly!!! Well, anyways I tossed them and opened this Norelco kit and I charged it up overnight (I didn’t need to, but I did). I figured out how to attach the guards – they are not typical at all but once I figured out how to install them, I realized the genius of the design., This Norelco trimmer series 5000 runs cordless and corded. The kit comes with 3 guard combs – and you don’t need more because the trimmer is designed with a dial that raises and lowers the guard comb to get 40 adjustments. The combs are designed with 2 ‘legs’ that slide into the trimmer so that the dial pushes and pulls on them for the adjustments. The trimmer is equipped with a USB port and comes with a charger; it charges up in about an hour and the cordless runtime is about 2 hours. But the best feature of its power is the fact that it runs while charging! This trimmer is easy to clean with the brush that’s included. And it can be washed as well. I wouldn’t take a shower using it; there’s just no good that comes from that even if you can wash the parts out… An oil bottle is also included – the little things that go a very long way. This is a very solid built trimmer. And a great buy as well. The only thing I would suggest for the company is to include a little case and/or a storage bag – those would help a lot taking this unit anywhere I go…

Review text: This trimmer is one of Philips Norelcos more affordable ones. My husband used an earlier model a few years ago and for a while it was his favorite. But this new Norelco has a few updated features. The ones my husband liked best are the improved lithium ion battery. It lasts noticeably longer and shouldn’t lose charge like the old nimh battery tech does. He also likes the metal slide/plate/bed rather than the plastic found on most cheaper models., This is a sleek and elegant trimmer that gives a look of premium materials with some nice lightly brushed stainless and chrome mixed with gloss and matte black plastics. It is all plastic but looks a bit more classy when left out on the bathroom counter., My husband mostly uses the trimmer without attachments as a stubble trimmer but does use the attachments to trim his sideburns before they get too wild and Wolverineish. The attachments are also good for catching stray eyebrow hairs; just make sure you set the attachment with plenty of height so you don’t shave your eyebrows off by mistake., The trimmer works well. It has a thumb wheel that adjusts the height of the attachments with an illuminated dial giving you the grade. The three attachments are different height ranges. You can use it as a stubble trimmer without attachments. It does a reasonably close shave leaving you with a two-day stubble. My husband prefers this method of shaving because it doesn’t aggravate his skin as much so he is less likely to get acne. The steel bed that glides over your skin is also easier to clean which helps here too., The blades are quite fine and not as wide as a hair dressers trimmer so it’s easier to do fine details and work around the nose and upper lip. Overall it does a good job and my husband is pleased with it.

The guards are not a good design if using on a regular length beard.  

I attempted to get a replacement after discovering the defective adjustment wheel -- Amazon was temporally out of product so would only offer a refund.

Review text: "  Trimmer it self is fabulous as it feels and cuts well, but I bought this for the ability to adjust the trim levels at lower levels, which the provided comb is very poor at doing. The trimmer comes with 3 combs: 1 black and 2 gray. I do not have use of the gray combs because they are used for maintaining long beards, but thats okay because the black one can be used for maintaining short beards which is what I need. However there is this gap in the black comb which can let your skin get pushed into and be completely shaved. I like to maintain a shadow-y mustache, which is at level 2 with the black comb. When I trimmed, there were bald spots left due to the gap. Im not sure what the design engineers were thinking with this.", My older and much cheaper Philips trimmer has a comb with no gap and that does an excellent job at cutting hair at lower levels, except the Ni-MH battery in it is going bad, hence I decided to buy a more expensive model with Li-ion. If this model could employ the same gap-less comb design I will buy it.

I should’ve listened..., Guess it’s time to try a new brand.

Review text: "  I have used a couple of different trimmers like this one over the years, sometimes for a beard and sometimes just for eyebrows, sideburns, etc.  As technology has improved, so have some of the features offered by this trimmer over my older ones.  I particularly like the digital readout for the cutting head height.  With this, its very clear what setting youre on so long as you read the proper scale of the two (its not confusing).  This also charges pretty quickly and a charge seems to last a pretty good while.  It comes with three plastic protectors to allow you to set the cutting height for stubble and out to a longer beard.  I dont see why you also couldnt use it for hair.  I like everything about this trimmer except that it doesnt come with a bag to store it in or carry it.  Just a simple mesh bag would be fine and I think some kind of bag should be provided.  I now have mine in a ziplock clear bag and its not really what Id prefer."

Review text: The most innovative part of the BT5511 is the ability to see on the illuminated dial the exact length to which the adjustable guard is set. There are three guards, one for hair, one for short beards, and one for longer beards. I used the short beard one at 5 mm, and the hair at the same. There was no tugging, and the final product looked excellent., My only complaint? Despite the assertion that it is a "one pass" trimmer, my think, curly beard took many, many passes in multiple directions to come out even and clean. Fortunately, the battery life is excellent, with plenty of juice for both my bear and hair, and it's a comfortable trimmer in the hands., "You will still want a detail trimmer. The BT5211 does great without a guard: no nicks, and it cuts close; but, its too wide for most detail work.", If you don't set your expectations too high for the "one pass" claim, this is a solid option.

The beard trimmer and nose hair trimmer both have very shiny chrome vacuum plated plastic.  

Blades of the beard trimmer look robust but are very fine toothed.  

Compared to my old trimmer the Wahl is much quieter.  

The plastic attachments are somewhat rough and fiddly - the 6-way guide seemed to attach more firmly and function better than the other fixed length attachments but popped loose in use resulting in a significant notch in my mustach that will eventually grow back out.

Review text:
This is the third Wahl trimmer that I've owned.

The first one was great and eventually the clips that held the blades in place broke off after years of use.

This is the second trimmer that I've had to throw out, the other because of broken teeth on the trimmer head, this one due to incredible dull so-called "self sharpening" blades.

I used this once for some light trimming when I first charged it, and it pulled a bit and didnt cut well and I thought maybe I just didnt charge enough.

Review text:
The quality woes have begun to affect their blades.

This trimmer did not cut effectively.

It required multiple passes to cut the hair, leaving inconsistent cut lengths in its path.

Furthermore, after every single pass, tiny hairs get caught between the blades and make a loud clicking sound until air is blown through the assembly.

The tolerances of the blades are just horribly loose.

Its utter junk that doesnt do what it was designed for.

"Its been about 2 and a half years since I bought this, and the battery life has diminished to the point where I cant fully groom my face and head before the motor dies.

Review text: "  I have been searching for a good electric shaver solution and have so far found none.  This Panasonic shaver uses a back-and-forth vibrating electric motor that does not spin like other models.  The idea is good, but this shaver mostly became too frustrating to use after about 3 months.  The vibrating back-and-forth motor began to change speeds all of the time even when fully charged.  Then it just suddenly stalled and refused to cut.  After a few minutes it might again be able to run, but also might not.  This intermittent stalling of the cutter frustrated me and I couldnt find a work-around for it, so I gave up.  Otherwise, it gave a good shave.", By the way these modern electric shavers all say that they are water-proof, but I find that this is not the case.  When I opened my Panasonic shaver to see why it stopped working, I discovered that the inside of it was gooped up with hair and water.  So my take-away was to never spray out the shaver, just the blades and foil cover., I have also tried Braun and Wahl shavers which have their different problems.  Braun shavers have the little plastic nibs which move the shaving head back-and-forth wear out and pop-off.  These nibs are on the shaver itself and not on the replaceable foil-and-cutter.  When they break, which usually takes about 3 months, the shaver becomes useless.  I tried to use dental-brace-rubber-bands to hold the nibs together, but that also stops being effective after a time and is a hassle., My experience with Wahl is that the Wahl models are more solidly built that either the Braun or Panasonic; however, the Wahl models burn through the foil-and-cutter-replacements faster, too faster.

Review text: I got this for my son to use. It is perfect for a first time electric razor because my son doesn’t need a million attachments to shave his face. He really only has his sideburns, mustache and a little goatee that needs to be kept up. But I love that the 2 attachments that came with it have different length settings on it so he does have options in case he wants to keep some length (even though I prefer him to shave it all off). It also came with a plug and a little bottle of oil for the blades.  The only thing it didn’t come with was a bag to keep it in.  So storing it without losing the parts was a challenge, but we figure it out.  That would be the only thing that I didn’t like about it.  But otherwise great product and it gave my son a nice clean close shave.  Almost as close as a razor blade.

Finer hairs can enter the smaller holes above and below that area., I feel no grabbing or pulling from this cutter system.  No redness or skin irritation., To clean, you just put a bit of liquid soap on the screen and run it while running water over the head.  The screen pops off, This is FAR easier to clean than a Norelco triple rotary, with all the dismantling of the cutting head.  Norelco replacement heads are also expensive and hard to find for models a few years old., The trimmer head pops up when you slide a button, and it does a good job of trimming., Depth control when trimming eyebrows or other delicate areas comes from two adjustable plastic guards that snap onto the extended trimmer.  One guard has length settings of 1,2,3 and the other 4,5,6., My only complaints are that there is no battery charge indicator (not surprising at this relatively low price) and the Key of G whine that the shaver makes when its running.  Norelcos have a satsfying whirring sound, and in a quiet house I think someone shaving with this unit would be heard in nearby bedrooms., "The construction of this shaver comes off as adequate, but kind of cheap.  I have not explored more expensive Panasonic models, but Im betting that jumping up a model level would take care of that.", This is a good entry level shaver, or a test case for switching from rotary shavers to this style., Based on my experience with this entry level model, my next shaver will probably be a more upscale Panasonic.

Review text: Panasonic Hybrid Wet Dry Shaver, Trimmer & Detailer with Two Adjustable Trim Attachments, Pop-up Precision, "My son has one of those trendy beards that is very shaped with multiple angles and lengths. I think this is better suited for people that just want a straight shave with no intricate features.", From the website:, "HYBRID BEARD TRIMMER AND SHAVER - Shave, trim and detail hair, mustaches and beards all with one versatile, high-performance mens grooming tool", PRECISION SHAVING - Japanese crafted, 3 inner blade/outer foil shaver captures & cuts hair for smooth, close shaving. A smart shaving sensor detects beard, COMB ATTACHMENTS - For beards and mustaches, 2 clip-on comb attachments provide 7 trim length settings for touchups and styling. An integrated slide-up, CORDLESS RAZOR - Quiet, high-speed 13, 000 CPM Linear Motor maintains peak performance throughout battery life to optimize cordless shaving, detailing and trimming results, WET DRY CONVENIENCE - Shave, trim and groom dry anytime or in the shower; washable design makes maintenance simple - just rinse groomer under warm, running water

Review text: I have used many different electric shavers previously. They all require an adjustment period before they really start to work effectively. Typically this adjustment period takes about 1 week for your face to get used to the new shaver. I read the instructions for this Panasonic shaver which states that the adjustment period takes 30 days! In practice though I found that after around 1 week it was cutting effectively. The first few cuts missed several spots as expected but by the end of the week it was working as expected with no missed areas. There were no pulled hairs or cuts and the shaver cuts as close as you would expect from an electric shaver which will never be as close as a razor. The shaver is quieter than most electric shavers and shaving time was faster than average., The instructions also state that you should use foaming hand soap to clean the shaver under running water. I had never seen a shaver where soap was recommended for cleaning but it actually works very well. This is one of the easiest cleaning shavers I have ever used. I expected to see hair under the foil cover after cleaning under the faucet but I was surprised not to find any and the foil had not been removed to clean the shaver head. One note though is that you need to be careful to hold the shaver lower in the sink as cleaning too close to the faucet with the shaver running tends to throw water everywhere., "The shaver arrived uncharged but only took about 1 hour to charge. It seems to hold a charge well and lasts for a considerable time before needing a re-charge. You cant use the shaver while charging which I believe is a safety feature since it is a wet/dry shaver. The shaver is comfortable to hold and the power button is not in the way of the grip so no accidental activation or turning off during shaving. The design of the shaver head is also well thought out as there are no areas for hair to collect or hide under the foil or cutters unlike a previous rotary shaver that I used which was impossible to keep clean.", When I first got this shaver my initial impression was that it was a shaver trying to moonlight as a beard trimmer. I had a dedicated beard trimmer/ body shaver from another manufacturer to compare it to.  In use the beard trimmer does a decent job with 2 attachment heads that have adjustable lengths. These attachments go over the flip out trimmer on the back of the shaver. For quick trims or minor adjustments this arrangement works but compared to the dedicated trimmer the Panasonic is too small and slow to be used as a complete replacement so my initial opinion seems to be correct in regards to the beard trimmer function., "Overall this is a quality shaver with quick charging, easy cleaning, decent battery life thats comfortable and fairly quick and quiet. For minor trims or fixes or with no other options the beard trimmer works but I wouldnt want to use it on a daily basis for that. As a shaver I would definitely recommend it but I dont think that it will eliminate the need for a dedicated beard trimmer."

Review text:
Switched over to electric razors about 8 years ago.

Replaced an old Braun 3-series which, even with fresh foils/blades, was pretty abrasive on my face.  

This Panasonic model gave me a much more comfortable shave, although it still took multiple passes for a close shave in some of my "problem areas" like neck and under chin.  

On the plus side, it was a little quieter than the Braun, comfortable in my hand and I was generally pleased with the performance.

Review text:
I tried other brands for several years, and really wanted to like them.

But my latest shaver still left behind significant stubble after a fresh shave, that I dont get until evening now.

Im well into my 2nd week of battery life, with no signs of slowing down.

I use the sideburn trimmer on the back of my neck, I cant stand a hairy neck.

Even the sideburn trimmer trims more closely than any other shaver Ive had in many years.

Review text:
The cable is usb not straight into outlet, you will need your own block adapter.

The stand was a big selling point for me to be honest.

It’s compact and holds everything nicely and looks cool.

If I had any complaints it would be that it takes a couple of runs to clean the wide areas of short stubble.

So I’d say it’s not super strong readily, my husbands beard is usually kept only an inch or so.

I can’t be sure but I’d think it might be harder to manage long beard hair.

This trimmer feels, sounds and looks as solid as the old Wahl professional trimmer Ive used for years;  its just more compact.

Great little machine."

Review text:
"Product is a disappointment.

Advertised as suitable for hair styling, but really only adequate for shorter, finer hair.

With the adjustable guard in place the blades thin the hair rather than reduce length.

The guard is flimsy and not precise.

The cutting head needs to be cleaned on every pass.

The battery only lasted no more than 8-10 minutes, not 60 minutes as advertised.

Maybe Im expecting performance from a more expensive product, but dont waste your money on this one."

Review text: "Ive been using Braun trimmers for years to cut my own hair and trim. I love the idea of the dial adjustable length. No more need to pop in and out fixed length guard head attachments. I tested this model cutting my own hair and my wifes.  I like to keep my hair longer on top and completely shaved on the sides. This was a good test for the smaller trimmer head. It worked phenomenal. It was very sharp and the hairs cut like butter. The razor is easy to maneuver and changing the dial setting is a snap. I was able to give myself a precision salon hair cut. As for my wife, I used the larger hair cutting guard because she has longer hair. It worked great too. Once you fidget with the dial setting to get the perfect length, the rest is a piece of cake. Changing the guard heads is a snap. They simply slide in and out. Once in the the guard stays put. I would caution one thing. Make sure not to bump the dial accidentally going too fast. I wasnt paying attention and accidentally knocked the dial to the wrong hair cutting length. Luckily I caught it before it was too late. The dial should be a bit stiffer to avoid accidents from happening. The battery lasted around 40 minutes. I had to finish the two cuts with it plugged in. Not a problem but do know the battery doesnt last an hour at full charge. It takes an hour to charge it fully too. As to the longevity of the battery, time will tell.  The razor is made of mostly hard plastic. That being said it feels decently well built in the hand and is light. I didnt have a problem cleaning it. It comes with a little cleaning brush too. I wish this included razor oil. It didnt. Also, It didnt come with a carrying bag or case. That was a little disappointing. End of the day, its how the razor performs and this one does a fantastic job in that department. Im giving this 4 stars based on performance. Im taking 1 away because of the dial issue, lack of bag and sketchy battery."

This one is constructed more like professional actual trimmers so that it has a sturdier head but is easy to disassemble and clean.  It has a more than adequate motor and battery to get through my thick beard, Ive had it for about 3 months now and it hasnt jammed or pulled or sputtered while trimming once.  Very happy with this one."

Review text: "Didnt know what to think of this trimmer but this is a true definition of all the bells and whistles. Review text:
I spent weeks researching beard trimmers, reading hundreds of user reviews and comparing features.  

So happy I chose this Braun!  

Most of these things come with 5 to 40 attachments, combs.

etc., which I need like a hole in the head.  

My Braun has two durable combs, and when you turn the dial you can select anything from barely visible stubble to just under 1".  

The design and build quality are solid, smooth and a joy to work with.  

It's the BMW of Beard trimmers.

Review text:
Its such an odd design.  

I just dont get what they were thinking.", And the adjustable guards - they don't cut hair at the length they are supposed to.  

Let's say you set the trimmer to a '15.'  

The length from the guard to the cutting blade is a '15' in one dimension, but hair will "fall" toward the other part of the guard which is much closer to the blade so you end up getting a much closer cut (let's say a '7').

Review text:
"Ive been using Braun trimmers for years to cut my own hair and trim.

I love the idea of the dial adjustable length.

I will be buying another brand.

Review text:
The advertisement says, "To be handsome man..."

Well, I'm not going to hold that against them, I've been trying for decades with no luck, but they shouldn't make promises they cannot keep.

LOL, Seriously, it is a good upper-midrange beard-trimming kit.

I also use it to manscape and to trim around my ears.

, I get good, precise results and it is easy to clean.

Review text: Everything about this buzzer is great.  The quality is that of a pair of professional clippers found in a barber shop or hair salon than one of those cheesy light weight jobs that line the aisles every holiday season., The blades are heavy weight and sharper than the standard blades typically found in buzzers of this size and price point. Recharges fast and showed no sign of slowing down even when used for an extended period of time.  My sasquatch-esque boyfriend found it perfectly handled every bit of heavy duty manscaping he used it for., I had the "pleasure" of using it on his overgrown back and it shaved it clean.  No pulling or catching of his hair or skin and left his skin smooth sans stubble., Would have been nice if it included an actual hard case of zipper pouch as opposed to the thin drawstring bag it came with.  Thats the only part that gives off a mediocre vibe for a tool that is anything but., I hope our humble opinion helps you in some way., Thank you for reading.

Review text:
"Got this as a Christmas gift, but found that the trimmer doesnt hold a charge at all.

Ive tried letting it charge for well over and hour and the digital readout displays a full battery, but doesnt power up at all.

If I plug it back, it shows an empty battery.

I looked inside and found the battery used was a garbage 2000mha 18650.

This is what happens when you go with the lowest bidder to build your product.", But it came in a pretty box, and can be used as a paperweight, so 2 stars.

Review text:
I needed to trim my hair.

After two plus months since the lockdown began, my hair needed to be cut.

This beard and mustache trimmer was recommended to me.

I was NOT trimming a beard but it worked well on my head.

I am not sure how to use the attachments.

Looks pretty complicated.

But the 5 in one comb pushed to its shortest cut did the job.

Did I miss a few spots?

Probably.

But it feels so much better.

, I charged the battery for 16 hours as stated in the instructions.

Review text: I bought mine at CVS because I was there, it was there, and why wait for delivery?  The price was about the same.  Got it home, charged it fro 16 hours, and using it with the default setup of just the trimmer was great.  Plenty of power, fast blade movement that didn’t tug, and it worked for several uses on one charge., The problem is cleaning it and using the shaving foil.  The instructions do not say anything about disassembly or how to put it all back together, or how to attach the shaving foil.  This is why you have to read the minds of the engineers who designed this thing.  I tried to put it back together on my own, but it’s a puzzle I can’t solve.  Internet searches weren’t helpful because the model shown was always just a little different than what I’ve got.  I’ll be taking it back - in pieces - to CVS for a refund.

Review text: I bought mine at CVS because I was there, it was there, and why wait for delivery?  The price was about the same. Plenty of power, fast blade movement that didn’t tug, and it worked for several uses on one charge., The problem is cleaning it and using the shaving foil.  The instructions do not say anything about disassembly or how to put it all back together, or how to attach the shaving foil.  This is why you have to read the minds of the engineers who designed this thing.  I tried to put it back together on my own, but it’s a puzzle I can’t solve.  Internet searches weren’t helpful because the model shown was always just a little different than what I’ve got.  I’ll be taking it back - in pieces - to CVS for a refund.

Review text: This hair trimmer set is a very complete set for haircuts and/or beard trimming.  The set arrives nicely boxed.  Included in the set are the hair trimmer, several different guide lengths, a charging cable, a universal voltage adapter, a cleaning brush, and a charger stand.  Best of all, all of these items are packed in a generously sized vinyl zippered bag that has several interior pockets to keep all of the accessories organized., The trimmer feels very solidly built.  Yet is weighs very little.  It has an LED digital display to tell you exactly how much charge is left.  The one I received was almost fully charged on arrival.  I charged it up for about an hour just to make sure before giving it a trial run.  The trimmer head has a dial so the cutting head can be adjusted to get a very precise cut when edging.  The guides snap on very securely.  So securely, in fact, that I found it difficult to get them on and off the trimmer.  During use, the trimmer is one of the quietest ones I have ever used.  It cuts and trims with ease.  Estimated run time between charges is 4 hours., There are several things I especially like about this trimmer.  The adjustable precision cut is really nice for trimming my moustache and at the edges of my beard.  The charging stand is really handy and is a feature not found on many trimmers.  The stand interfaces with the charging cable and enables me to stand the trimmer upright in its stand for charging.  This saves a lot of counter space.  And the storage bag for this trimmer is really nice.  It is made of thick vinyl, has lots of interior pockets for storing all of the small accessories, and has a sturdy zipper., Some things I dislike are the lack of an edge guard for the trimmer blade when it’s not in use.  The trimmer is exposed to potential damage if carried around in the storage bag.  I keep mine in the foam enclosure that the trimmer was packed in originally.  The foam fits inside the storage bag with room to spare.  I also dislike how hard it is to remove the cutting guards.  It is genuinely a struggle to get them off., "Overall, I really like this trimmer set.  If the trimmer guards were easier to use, it would be perfect.  Im hoping this will improve over time.  It is a great way to maintain a beard, but it could be used for home haircuts, too, if desired.  It is priced about $20 higher than other similar trimmers, but I think some of this higher price can be justified by its better build quality and handy extras not included with other brands."

Processed_QA_Content: The trimmer feels solidly built yet weighs very little, making it portable and easy to carry.
accept1: The trimmer feels solidly built yet weighs very little, making it portable and easy to carry.

Review text: "Ok so here is my tale of mom woe. Its a pandemic and my toddler needed his first hair cut...I attempted to cut it with scissors the first time and it worked...sort of. It wasnt the best b/c toddlers squirm, but it was ok. I thought in my infinite wisdom (none...no wisdom was used) thought if I used the longest hair guard it would cut it that length. Yeah...clearly I have no ideas what the heck Im doing because one swipe later and my face just went...OH SNAP (note that I did not say snap). Now if you excuse me, Im going to cry over some tiny little baby onesies."

Review text: This hair trimmer set is a very complete set for haircuts and/or beard trimming.  The set arrives nicely boxed.  Included in the set are the hair trimmer, several different guide lengths, a charging cable, a universal voltage adapter, a cleaning brush, and a charger stand.  Best of all, all of these items are packed in a generously sized vinyl zippered bag that has several interior pockets to keep all of the accessories organized., The trimmer feels very solidly built.  Yet is weighs very little.  It has an LED digital display to tell you exactly how much charge is left.  The one I received was almost fully charged on arrival.  I charged it up for about an hour just to make sure before giving it a trial run.  The trimmer head has a dial so the cutting head can be adjusted to get a very precise cut when edging.  The guides snap on very securely.  So securely, in fact, that I found it difficult to get them on and off the trimmer.  During use, the trimmer is one of the quietest ones I have ever used.  It cuts and trims with ease.  Estimated run time between charges is 4 hours., There are several things I especially like about this trimmer.  The adjustable precision cut is really nice for trimming my moustache and at the edges of my beard.  The charging stand is really handy and is a feature not found on many trimmers.  The stand interfaces with the charging cable and enables me to stand the trimmer upright in its stand for charging.  This saves a lot of counter space.  And the storage bag for this trimmer is really nice.  It is made of thick vinyl, has lots of interior pockets for storing all of the small accessories, and has a sturdy zipper., Some things I dislike are the lack of an edge guard for the trimmer blade when it’s not in use.  The trimmer is exposed to potential damage if carried around in the storage bag.  I keep mine in the foam enclosure that the trimmer was packed in originally.  The foam fits inside the storage bag with room to spare.  I also dislike how hard it is to remove the cutting guards.  It is genuinely a struggle to get them off., "Overall, I really like this trimmer set.  If the trimmer guards were easier to use, it would be perfect.  Im hoping this will improve over time.  It is a great way to maintain a beard, but it could be used for home haircuts, too, if desired.  It is priced about $20 higher than other similar trimmers, but I think some of this higher price can be justified by its better build quality and handy extras not included with other brands."

QA_Content: The user has mentioned that if the trimmer guards were easier to use, it would be perfect.
Processed_QA_Content: If the trimmer guards were easier to use, it would be perfect.
accept1: If the trimmer guards were easier to use, it would be perfect.

Review text: This hair trimmer set is a very complete set for haircuts and/or beard trimming.  The set arrives nicely boxed.  Included in the set are the hair trimmer, several different guide lengths, a charging cable, a universal voltage adapter, a cleaning brush, and a charger stand.  Best of all, all of these items are packed in a generously sized vinyl zippered bag that has several interior pockets to keep all of the accessories organized., The trimmer feels very solidly built.  Yet is weighs very little.  It has an LED digital display to tell you exactly how much charge is left.  The one I received was almost fully charged on arrival.  I charged it up for about an hour just to make sure before giving it a trial run.  The trimmer head has a dial so the cutting head can be adjusted to get a very precise cut when edging.  The guides snap on very securely.  So securely, in fact, that I found it difficult to get them on and off the trimmer.  During use, the trimmer is one of the quietest ones I have ever used.  It cuts and trims with ease.  Estimated run time between charges is 4 hours., There are several things I especially like about this trimmer.  The adjustable precision cut is really nice for trimming my moustache and at the edges of my beard.  The charging stand is really handy and is a feature not found on many trimmers.  The stand interfaces with the charging cable and enables me to stand the trimmer upright in its stand for charging.  This saves a lot of counter space.  And the storage bag for this trimmer is really nice.  It is made of thick vinyl, has lots of interior pockets for storing all of the small accessories, and has a sturdy zipper., Some things I dislike are the lack of an edge guard for the trimmer blade when it’s not in use.  The trimmer is exposed to potential damage if carried around in the storage bag.  I keep mine in the foam enclosure that the trimmer was packed in originally.  The foam fits inside the storage bag with room to spare.  I also dislike how hard it is to remove the cutting guards.  It is genuinely a struggle to get them off., "Overall, I really like this trimmer set.  If the trimmer guards were easier to use, it would be perfect.  Im hoping this will improve over time.  It is a great way to maintain a beard, but it could be used for home haircuts, too, if desired.  It is priced about $20 higher than other similar trimmers, but I think some of this higher price can be justified by its better build quality and handy extras not included with other brands."

QA_Content: The user has mentioned that the trimmer feels solidly built.
Processed_QA_Content: I feel that the trimmer is solidly built.
accept1: I feel that the trimmer is solidly built.

Review text: This is a huge upgrade from the traditional cable hair clipping machine! This is my first time trying a portable grooming kit, and I was able to cut my hair a lot faster without having to worry about a annoying cable getting in the way.  It arrives with a elegant case to store and protect the whole grooming kit., The machine is also elegantly designed and comes with a LED screen that shows the total usage time and battery level + more. The USB charging feature is great. Just plug the charging cable provided into any USB charger.  Overall, you can tell the quality is great when holding it.  It comes with a lot of accessories to get a lot of different jobs well done.  The machine battery lasts about 90 minutes, that is more then enough to get any job done.  There is nothing bad I can say about this machine, I am fully satisfied with my purchase and recommend it for personal, or even business use!

Review text: This all in one grooming kit really does the job.  It has a bright display letting you know how much battery remains.  It doesn’t burn through battery much.  After a week of using it I’m only in the high 80%. Keep in mind I use it daily as my beard grows fast., The trimmer comes with a expansive kit.  There are two trimmer heads which consist of one large trimmer and one smaller trimmer for the finer details.  There is a ear ear trimmer attachment and it beats my smaller battery powered one.  There is a beard trimmer with an adjustable guard along with the usual trimmer guard sizes.  One accessory I’ve never seen included… or even I didn’t know existed for a trimmer.. an electric trimmer for the parts of your face that your not trying to extend your beard too.  I love this attachment the best.  Finally, one feature that really isn’t a feature but it’s a nice addition is that the charger port is a standard micro usb.  I have trimmers from different brands and they all have these random chargers with big bricks and it’s more bulk to deal with or lose.  So much easier to have a charging port that uses a universal cable., My buddy saw my kit while using my bathroom and had to go through it.  Well, then he decided to try it.  He came down after a bit and he explains “that trimmer kit is AWESOME!”.  Obviously I respond “I know but you seriously used my trimmer?!”.  I can’t blame him, it’s seriously awesome.  I had to try it right when I opened the box., With the current $10 coupon this is grooming kit is a steal.  Grab it while you can!  It rivals my Wahl and Remington Trimmers and is replacing both.

Review text: VIKICON Electric Beard Trimmer, Upgraded Hair Clippers Hair Trimmer for Men, Waterproof Grooming Kit, Electric Body Groomer, Precision Razor with Beard Bib & Storage Box, USB Rechargeable Nose Trimmer, and my thoughts., Used it right away!, This terrific set came today! Tomorrow I have a sleep study and will be sleeping in the lab, which apparently looks like a simple hotel room. They told me I could not use hairspray, gel, mousse, pomade, wax, egg whites, or mayonnaise. My hair must be free. Well, it looks like spun, platinum angel hair so I cannot simply give it away! Whatever, shall I do?, "My hair is very fine and hasnt the body like the llama I dont have and I need to wash, blow-dry, and affix it in a desirable fashion for the paparazzi.  No hair products? Sheesh! I almost canceled! but this grooming set came today and I thought it would be ideal to cut my hair really short and not have to worry about hair products. Besides, I never go anywhere anyway but the market or medical places, so, it would be fine. Plus, I have been strictly cutting my own hair for decades, and it was a side business in Hollywood for the film industry and all the while a hobby to give free cuts and styles my whole life. And this was a new set to do just that with!", "I charged it up and it was rather quick! I used it for about 45 minutes and it went from 100 to 98, which is terrific!  I have no idea how long the battery actually lasts but based on my usage today, I think it holds a charge well. So, 5 stars for that. Okay, thats the power.", It is easy to use, very comfortable and sturdy, feels most professional and I know a bit about that, and all the attachments work great! I gave myself a great haircut, fade and all, trimmed my sparse eyebrows but they look great now, trimmed my chest and stomach, and then decided to shave it all and it was easy and great. I also used the small nose and ear trimmer, great, the small detail attachment on my sideburns, and, of course, almost all of the gage clips. I also tried out the body attachment and that is great, too!, "It wasnt very loud, was very easy to clean even without the brush, and it is just a great set!", I recommend this and say it would undoubtedly make a terrific gift for any man with hair they tend to anywhere. It can also, of course, be used for any females who groom themselves with such tools. It is neither masculine nor feminine, to me, it is just great and I used it right away! Sweet dreams!

Review text: First impression is that it is well made. Solid main body. It is very quiet and has two cutting speeds. Charges quickly. There are many different heads and trim lengths. Although expensive, it seems worth it., "After trying out. Trim length for beards - there is a frustrating gap between lengths at the shorter end. I like to trim at 2-3 mm but with this I only have the choice of very short by trimming with the blades against my skin for about a 1mm cut (it works well at that length) or I have to go longer to what is realistically about 4mm with the shortest attachment. I was not happy about that but since its not returnable after use, Ive adapted to 1mm trims and letting it grow in.", As far as durability goes. Everything is well made and easy to clean. However, two concerns:, "1. The plastic parts seem like they could break if you arent careful when putting on/taking off. I can see myself snapping these within a year or so. I doubt it is possible to get replacement parts.", "2. The heads have to be put on in a fairly precise manner. Again, you must be careful when snapping them into place - it needs to be lined up perfectly before snapping the head on with a fair amount of pressure. Im concerned that the wear and tear after a year or so of this will cause connecting pieces to be damaged. My most favorite feature with these is the fact they are waterproof, it speeds up my self care & cleaning time.

It comes with a lot of accessories to get a lot of different jobs well done.  The machine battery lasts about 90 minutes, that is more then enough to get any job done.  There is nothing bad I can say about this machine, I am fully satisfied with my purchase and recommend it for personal, or even business use!

Review text: My husband uses hair/beard trimmers to shave because the regular electric shavers tend to irritate his face. He is going on a long haul flight and wanted something affordable and light weight to take in his carry on. His regular clipper probably weighs a couple of pounds so that was a no-go., This one is all plastic, medium size with many attachments. The whole comes in a surprisingly nice shell case with cutouts for the shaver and each of the attachments. The trimmer itself is slender and light weight. He uses the trimmer without any attachments. There is a single control button. You press it once for a slow/medium speed. Press again for fast and a third time to turn it off. Slow speed did not cut as well and occasionally did pull on a whisker. High speed works much better and provides a decent trim with maybe a one-day stubble. He found the shaver somewhat noisy (typical for a light weight plastic trimmer). Of the attachments, the body trimmer with its angled attachment was good for the shoulder and neck areas and the combs for trimming sideburns also worked well., Battery life seems good and it cuts well at high speed, charges via USB which is convenient if you’re planning to take it on a trip. No need for AC adapters and such. For the price it’s very good. Better than competing mainstream brands at this price point.

Review text: I bought this not for trimming my beard (I am clean-shaven), but for trimming my hair.  I usually do that with a cordless trimmer and use a 3/8th-inch comb to get an even buzz-cut.  This trimmer is much more convenient than my old trimmer., First of all, there is no need to fiddle with various combs, snapping them on, snapping them off, etc.  There is just one comb to this trimmer, and the rotary dial makes it so convenient to adust the length of the comb perfectly.  It just so happens that 3/8ths of an inch is almost exactly equal to 10 mm, which is the longest setting on this trimmer.  So, I just set this trimmer to 10 mm, and voila, my haircuts are simple and straightforward.  You can remove the comb to shape the edges and make your haircut sharp if you want.  The comb does not snap on and off, instead it is a simpler design with the comb simply fitting into slots on the side of the trimmer head., "The trimmer is very quiet and it doesnt sound like you are trying to groom yourself during a tornado when you use it.", The cleanup is also much simpler.  My hair trimmer is very finicky about not being dunked in water.  Cleaning it with a stiff-haired brush is no fun.  This beard trimmer is fully wet and dry, so it can be used in the shower if you want.  I use it on dry hair, but after use, I simply wash it in running water and clean out all the hair without any hassles., It has a long run-time on a single charge, and I can typically go 4 or 5 uses between charges.  The charger is a little unconventional in that you plug the trimmer into the charger which is plugged into the wall.  There is no charger cord, but it works, that is what matters., "My only con for this trimmer is that the head is narrower than my hair trimmers head, so it takes a little more time to fully pass it over all parts of my scalp.", Overall, much more convenient, lots less parts to worry about and keep track of, long battery life, very easy clean-up.  It is time to retire my regular hair trimmer or keep it around only for dire emergencies.

Review text: First of all, this is a completely unbiased review as I paid for this item, unlike most of the Vine reviews that you see posted., "I was recently in the market for a new beard trimmer. I had grown tired of the one I was using (Braun Cruzer) and it seemed like it wasnt as powerful as it used to be. It also felt like it wasnt holding its charge as well and as a result, starting to pull my beard while trimming. So I set off to do some research to find a replacement...", "I probably looked for a couple of weeks before finally settling on the Panasonic ER-GB80-S. My biggest drawback was the price. I had a very hard time paying $100 for something I was going to use mostly once a week. Not to mention, it was also over $40 more than the hair clipper that I purchased with it. With that being said, I dont mind paying a little bit extra for a high quality product. I know it says that it can be used to hair but I prefer to have a dedicated clipper for that. Initially I was skeptical because most of the reviewers had were a part of the Vine program. But, theyre SUPPOSED to give a fair and honest review, right? So I eventually caved and purchased it because I wasnt thrilled by my other options. I was impressed that it had 39 different settings and could be rinsed under the faucet for quick and easy cleaning.", "When I received it in the mail, I honestly couldnt wait to use it. I do most of my shaving on Friday night/Saturday morning (because of my profession, I dont have to shave as frequently as others might). So Friday finally arrived and it was time to put it to a test. I noticed a huge difference immediately! Trimming my beard to stubble was enjoyable again! My hair wasnt pulled once and the motor never lost an ounce of power. I tried a few of the different settings before going to the shortest one. The dial turned smoothly and clicked at each individual setting. With so many options, it would be hard to find one that you didnt like! The precision trimmer worked flawlessly also. I mostly use that to trim around my mustache area.", "Cleaning and oiling it was a breeze. I ran it under water to remove all the hair and havent seen any side effects from doing so. As with any product that has moving parts, maintenance is key. You should always use the provided oil before and after each use to keep it in top shape!", "So why only 4 stars? Because theres not an option to give it 4.5 stars and the price. While Im extremely happy that I purchased it (it provides me with the most comfortable shaving experience Ive ever had), I feel that it could have been offered for a lesser price than what I paid for it ($100). The travel pouch also left a lot to be desired. I dont expect it to last very long but I also dont plan on using it that often either. With all that being said, if you use it for everything that it offers, maybe its worth $100 to you. Either way, you wont be sorry that you bought it!"

Neither the slide trimmer nor the body hair attachment allow for any adjustment.

The clipper blades themselves werent terrible just not what Ive come to expect compared to other brands.  Cleaning them seemed more difficult than should be. Now days so many waterproof clippers have the blade and blade assembly easily pop right off to be rinsed and oiled, however, these do not. Also for a pair of waterproof/resistant clippers they rust far to easily. I suggest keep shopping, these seem like a relic from the past."

There are a nice collection of attachments to manage hair length including some rarely seen scruffy look combs.

The travel bag is too small.

You cant fit everything in in.

In fact if you want to take the clippers and the nose hair trimmer, a decent quality addition, along youll end up leaving most of the other accessories behind.

Its too bad as this would be a great travel set.

All in all though its a solid workhorse and seems like it will last for years."

Review text: The Wahl trimmer is an excellent upgrade of a similar item I used that was a different brand. The trimmer itself is small and fits easily in your hand. It is light and turns on with a surprising amount of power (although it does not vibrate too much in your hand). The nose trimmer requires AA batteries to operate but is very convenient and light. There is a good selection of trim guards although I think they could be a little more clearly labeled. Both trimmers can be stored in a convenient, black canvas pack with two zipper compartments, making it easy to travel with and surprisingly small. Included with this package are a small comb, brush for cleaning the trimmer and oil to keep the blades running smoothly. Small, lightweight, convenient and packs a punch for smooth and effortless trimming!

Review text: "  I hate blade shaving. Almost every time I get skin irritation especially in the Florida heat and humidity. So, for years now I have relied on clippers to get a mild, I shaved yesterday look. I have gone through numerous sets of clippers from full size hair clippers which, since I also keep a goatee, are a little large to quite a few smaller models like this Wahl set. This is up near the top. Not quite the best only because they are a little rough on my skin. They are powerful and will mow through 3/4s of an inch of beard without even slowing down. There are a nice collection of attachments to manage hair length including some rarely seen scruffy look combs. The travel bag is too small. You cant fit everything in in. In fact if you want to take the clippers and the nose hair trimmer, a decent quality addition, along youll end up leaving most of the other accessories behind. Its too bad as this would be a great travel set. All in all though its a solid workhorse and seems like it will last for years."

Review text: At 69, shaving continues to be something I’ve never been much fond of, lol! So beginning of summer, when it was do or die for keeping my beard as 4 mths of near to at 100+ began, I ordered my Wahl beard trimmer. I’ve only tried a few things with, mostly changing out the guards to test how much is trimmed and weeded out from a week’s growth 😊 but I am very pleased with it. Have only needed to recharge it once, and was “very” glad it says the battery cannot be overcharged; so it was easy to follow the instructions and let it recharge overnight. Cleaning is relatively easy with a small whisk style brush. Oiling turned out to be also relatively painless, using only a few drops from the encl’d container of oil. And it’s amazing how the beard guards sweep through my beard (fairly rough) and both thin and crop it down to a nice size. I’ve even kept everything in its original box, unusual for me, as it’s small and handy to store and pull out. Highly recommend! 😊

The pros: Fancy/cool packaging & product design, long battery life, tons of attachments and accessories included, quiet operation.

CONS:

My old trimmer would take 1-2 minutes twice month to effectively cut those hairs down to literally nothing.

Review text:
The pros: Fancy/cool packaging & product design, long battery life, tons of attachments and accessories included, quiet operation.

CONS:

Its nose/ear cutting surface is SO safe, that it simply doesn't cut well.

My old trimmer would take 1-2 minutes twice month to effectively cut those hairs down to literally nothing.

To get "kinda" the same results (it is simply not possible for this machine to cut down as low/close as my previous one), this thing takes 10-15 minutes, 4x a month.

Review text: I bought this Wahl clipper to replace a no name device I bought on Amazon a couple of years ago.  That clipper served me well but was beginning to dull.  I was enthusiastic about this one based on reviews and brand name recognition.  Unfortunately this clipper has multiple issues.  First, the blade is very narrow, requiring many more passes to cover the entire face.  Second, it’s loud.  Very loud.  I have to put cotton balls in my ears prior to each trimming.  Not very convenient.  Again, I never had this problem with the previous clipper.  Finally, I’m under-impressed with the trimming ability.  The blade guards seem to be in between sizes and I can never seem to get that preferred cut.  Might be splitting hairs (no pun intended) but I just wish I had purchased a different trimmer.

Review text: "The Panasonic Body and Beard Trimmer is the best Ive ever owned; Id put it in the same class as the trimmer my barber uses.  The trimmer is a little bit heavier than the other brands, but thats a good thing.  The trimmer feels solid in your hand and is easy to guide.  The device is well engineered and does a great job keeping my beard and mustache trimmed cleanly.  Ive had it for three months now, and the blades are still sharp and it gives me the same trim that I got the day it arrived from Amazon.", "Ive owned many beard trimmers over the years.  The Wahl trimmers are lightweight, have a narrow cutting head, the beard-combs are flimsy plastic and easily move out of place, and after a couple months use, the blades seemed dull and I started getting uneven trims.  Ive owned three Braun Cruzers over the years; the Braun use to be my favorite until I discovered the Panasonic model.  The problem with the Braun is that it does not travel well.  The adjustable plastic comb is supported for use, but not for packing; every model Ive owned has suffered a broken comb in travel.  The Panasonics comb and adjustment mechanism do not suffer from the bizarre Braun design and thru three months of heavy travel, they have held up to airline baggage handlers and being thrown around by taxi drivers without a nick.", "My five-star rating is not to say that the Panasonic device is not without its flaws.  My real rating would been a 4.9 if Amazon allowed partial star ratings.  There are two areas of improvement that I hope Panasonic would consider.  First, the travel bag is a joke - its flimsy and there is not enough space for both the clipper and the charger; for nearly $100 Id expect more.  I found a Tumi zippered bag that does the trick for $7.", "Second, and this is a knock on all portable non-computer/phone devices with a charger, and that is, every low-power portable device should be USB-C compatible.  The voltage specs on the Panasonic charger indicate that the power requirements fit nicely inside the USB power capability.  I swear that 15% of my suitcase weight is attributable to chargers.  And once every couple of months, I realize Ive forgotten and donated an odd-ball charger to the hotel housekeeping staff. I would rather carry one or two USB chargers and two or three USB-C cables to power all of my devices.  And if I loose a cable or charger, its easily replaced; unlike the goofy charger and connector Panasonic provides.  And certainly with the commodity pricing of USB-C, Panasonic could probably shave-off no pun intended some of the bill-of-materials cost...  And now that I think about it for a bit, if Panasonic adopts USB-C charger connections, then there is no reason to increase the size of the travel bag."

Review text:
There is just one comb to this trimmer, and the rotary dial makes it so convenient to adust the length of the comb perfectly.  

It just so happens that 3/8ths of an inch is almost exactly equal to 10 mm, which is the longest setting on this trimmer.  

So, I just set this trimmer to 10 mm, and voila, my haircuts are simple and straightforward.  

You can remove the comb to shape the edges and make your haircut sharp if you want.

Review text: "My initial reaction after unpacking this was one of being impressed.  I own several trimmers (from smaller ones like this to professional hair clippers), and I really like the design and ergonomics of this model.  It fits well in my hand, is comfortable to use (to hold, and the the hair guard is smooth and doesnt jab at all), and I really like the dial for the length adjustment.", "Ill explain later, but up front - I recommend that you start with the length setting at a much larger value than you want and work your way down, as my experience is that the marked lengths are noticeably shorter than equivalent length markings on all of my other hair clipper blades.  The length issue is the reason that I took this down from five stars.  Everything else about it is awesome.", "Some reviewers dont like the design of the charger because it doesnt use a cord and plugs directly into the wall - which is actually why I love it.  I have trimmer power cords sprawled out around my bathroom...I did mention that I have several :)...and it looks messy because, well, it is.  I love that this charger serves as a base for the trimmer and plugs right into the wall.  I dont keep it plugged into the outlet all of the time - just when Im charging up the trimmer, so it doesnt really limit my use of that outlet.", "My first test was to trim the hair on my arms.  I dont trim that hair really short as Im no insert name of any well muscled person here, but I got tired of feeling like a Wookiee, so I trim it a bit.  I usually use a professional hair clipper from Oster to do that, and I set the dial on this Panasonic to the same length.  It works really well.  Very quiet, not much vibration at all, smooth gliding over my arms with the guard, and it cut the hair well.  I couldnt really tell if the hair length was any different than when I use the Oster, and I was very happy with it.", Skip forward to my next test - cutting the hair on my head.  I use a #1 blade (2.4 mm) to cut my hair, and it's all one length.  I dialed this to the closest setting, which is 2.5 mm and gave me (I thought) a tiny bit of extra length just in case.  I start on the back of my head, and...swipe.  "Hmmm, that feels shorter than normal."  Yeah, that's when I should have stopped.  It wasn't.  One more swipe on the side of my head - now I could see that it was not cutting to my regular length, but was noticeably shorter.  I checked the dial, and it hadn't moved from 2.5 mm.  I switched back to the Oster, but I've had a noticeable stripe down the back of my head for the past week (and I've been trimming every morning with the Oster to help it blend in better every day)., "So...I dont trust the length settings.  That said, it did a darn good job of cutting the hair on my head.  Seriously, it mowed through it pretty quickly and effectively.  It definitely works great, but be wary of going straight to the length setting that you usually use.  Again, I recommend starting out high and working your way down.  I know that Ill try this on my hair again, but Ill be following that advice the next time until I dial in just the right setting.", I do recommend this, with a single warning about the length settings.

Sharpness.  The very first time I used the trimmer, I used a setting that is a little closer than what I wanted.  This Panasonic trimmer did such an effective job in one short swipe that I was forced to do my entire beard at that short length.  This trimmer can almost be used as a shaver, it gets so close.  Using the expected horizontal sideburns trimmer requires removing an attached comb and pressing the sliding mechanism into the up position -- very similar to many other trimmers.  This one operates flawlessly., 4. Controls.  These all have such a quality feel.  The length dial is controlled horizontally and each setting clicks into place; this design means it is less likely to be changed during use, as the vast amount of users will be trimming with vertical movements up and down.  Also, this length control barrel design is changed from the side off the trimmer, making changes on the fly quick, easy, and very comfortable.  The on/off button and the horizontal trimming blade mechanism also have this smooth, quality feel and the combs slide in and out of place in side grooves rather than simply being snapped on and off.  Even the AC adapter and port/connector have this same attention to ergonomic detail., 5. Aesthetics.  It looks great., "6. Manual.  Many products have poorly written manuals but Panasonic has really gone out of its way to inform the user of this trimmers features, its operation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and even trimming technique such as diagrams on how to trim ones own hair evenly (criss-cross pattern across the scalp, for example).  Not only do I have a great tool to achieve the results I want, reading through this manual has actually helped me become a better self-groomer.", The only very, very minor criticism I can think of is that the width of the trimmer (i.e. the length of the blades themselves) is slightly narrow.  Perhaps if the trimmer were a little wider it might trim my hair even faster.  However, it might not be quite as maneuverable., Included in the box: trimmer, blade (detachable for cleaning), beard comb attachment, hair comb attachment, body hair attachment, AC adapter, cleaning brush, light machine oil, storage pouch, manual (and separate registration card, warranty, oiling instructions)., Highly recommended.

Review text:
"Cuts very well, but not close enough.

Definitely not a fan of the daily maintenance.

Having to apply oil daily becomes annoying quickly.

The dial controlling the cutting length is very handy and allows you to make even incremental changes.

This came fully charged, which was a surprise and weve not had to recharge in the two weeks weve had it.

Review text:
"I just used this well made trimmer for the first time.  

Motor seems good, and lots of adjustment options, but even at the lowest/shortest comb setting, it didnt seem to cut my mustache/beard close enough.  

Promised length of 1-1.5 mm on #1 setting wasnt happening.

Second, it’s loud.

Not very convenient.  

Again, I never had this problem with the previous clipper.

The blade guards seem to be in between sizes and I can never seem to get that preferred cut.  

Might be splitting hairs (no pun intended)

Review text:
Bought it for my husband for Christmas.

The trimmer itself is fine but the battery life is terrible.

At first he had to charge it every other time he used it (usually using it about 10-15 minutes or so).

Now, 6 months later it only lasts about 5 minutes on a full charge.

He’s tried leaving it plugged in while using but that doesn’t work and it will still die within about 5 minutes.

I’ve already ordered a different brand to replace it.

Save your money and buy something that will last.

Review text:
Owned a little over two months.

So far, so good.

The fine trimmer and clipper blades work very well, the fine trimmer (not the detail nose hair/detail trimmer) works great for very close trims without knicks.

, The "bodyhair" trimmer head *is not* knickless and should only be used with it's guard.

The guard, however, isn't nearly as tight and sturdy as you'd want.

Owned a little over two months.

So far, so good.

The fine trimmer and clipper blades work very well, the fine trimmer (not the detail nose hair/detail trimmer) works great for very close trims without knicks.

Review text:
Ordered this hair clipper for hair cut myself because of the shelter in place.

It works very well.

Has multifunctional trimmer and a stand.

Cordless means convenient and easy to use.

The batter life is long.

A full charge can use 4-5 times for about 20 minutes section.

, Updated on 11/6 : It is  just not working when I was going to use it this morning; just right after I was happily leave a nice review less than 2 weeks .

And the return window is closed:(.

I will have to buy a new one .

Review text:
I’ve been wearing a beard since 1976 and have gone through a few beard trimmers.

This one is in a category of its own.

Things I like: the weight, the dial, the feel, and the battery life.

Things I don’t like: the design of adjustable removable attachment, and the cutting head (blades).

The blades are dull and grabby making for hairs not being cut or pulling.

In combination with the attachment design it’s a poor trimming experience.

Review text:
The highest/longest setting is way shorter than I want trim my beard.

My previous trimmer set at a 7-8 was perfect length.

The setting of 10 (the highest setting) is probably half the length I want to keep my beard, and thus cuts MUCH too short.

I will likely upgrade to the BT475 which goes double the length."

Review text:
I purchased this product about 6 months ago and have had ample time to evaluate it.

The dial idea is a good one.

The problem with this product are that the cutting blades are extremely dull.

It hardly cuts anything.

You have to go back and forth over and over again to get it to cut.

If you take the plastic protector off to get a nice crisp cut line (like around a mustache) , again, it will not cut without going over and over it and it will not be a close cut.

Very disappointing!

Review text: "I bought this to take with me on an extended backpacking trip to Europe to keep my facial hair in check, figuring it cost about as much as a trim at the barber and could be left behind/tossed if it turned out to be a dud. It turned out to be one of the best things I bought with me. The battery lasts a surprisingly long time - I maybe had to charge it once every two weeks with semi-daily use. The cutting blade is sharp and precise, though it does need a guard on it to prevent cutting the skin. Knocking off one point for the guard itself, which is the weakest design element - it is difficult to replace on the blade once its removed for cleaning post-shave, and its made out of a flimsy plastic in comparison to the rest of the shaver (theres a small crack in it from the stress of taking it off and replacing it, and once it cracks more I dont think the shaver will be useable anymore.) Still, this has more than paid for itself and Im happy with my purchase."

QA_Content: The reviewer mentions that the cutting blade of the trimmer is sharp and precise, but it needs a guard to prevent cutting the skin.
Processed_QA_Content: The cutting blade of the trimmer is sharp and precise, but a guard is needed to prevent cutting the skin.

Review text:
I owned several Philips Norelco trimmers, which were always rated on top.

They did not last for more than a year before I needed replacement parts from Phillips, which they did under their warranty.

This trimmer is so much sturdier, it trimmers almost perfectly on the first pass.

The vacuum sucks up 98% of the hair and the battery lasts a very long time.

It is so much easier to set the length of the trim, and at smaller increments.

The motor is powerful and cleaning is simple.

Review text: This thing is great. I was cautious as it’s an as seen on tv item but after using it, it may become my first and possibly only trimmer. I was skeptical of the cutting function thinking they may have cheaped out since they added a vacuum function but I was way wrong. It cuts so smoothly I wasn’t sure it was cutting until I looked at my head! There is no trimmer sound at all, it’s all vacuum and even that is about as loud as a normal trimmer. It has plenty of capacity, I was able to trim/shave my whole head before it filled up. Once it does though, the vacuum no longer sucks the hair in and there can be some mess but if you empty it between head and face or Vice versa it won’t be an issue. It charges fast and actually comes with a charger—not just the cable. The guards ( almost electric razor short to very long) and dial work really well too. I am just blown away with just how well this thing works. I’m so glad I gave it a chance.

I owned several Philips Norelco trimmers, which were always rated on top.

This trimmer is so much sturdier, it trimmers almost perfectly on the first pass.

It is so much easier to set the length of the trim, and at smaller increments.

The motor is powerful and cleaning is simple.
