Review text: This is my third beard trimmer.  In one  picture trimmer one used anAA battery, the second trimmer was rechargeable, but with changeable heads.  Both of these left hair all over the sink.  I saw the Vacutrim on TV and thought worth a try, it’s returnable!  I’ve been using it since mid-October and I have no complaints.  Excellent battery life and easy to charge.  Using it is just like using an electric razor.  The trimming head is adjustable which eliminates changing trimmer heads!  Cleaning is as easy as 1,2,3….  1.) remove trimmer head, remove compartment door and shake out trimmings.  I cheat when cleaning and the few whiskers that don’t come out are easily removed by using canned air.  You never need to clean up whiskers again.  Two thumbs up 👍👍!!

Review text: I have a wide range of hair trimmers, from cheap Chinese ones to pro-grade trimmers, and these fall much closer to the cheaply built end. The trimmer comes with a whole bunch of attachments, most you will never use, and all are built of pretty flimsy plastic. The trimmer says wet/dry but if you wet it you will need to remove the blade each time since water will get trapped inside. The trimmer used a micro-USB cable to charge and comes with an included charger. I would only recommend this for teenagers just starting to groom.

He has a separate ear/nose hair trimmer that he was previously using but when traveling, its nice that he doesnt have to pack as many things. Its evenly cut and looks great every time.", The trimmer itself has the perfect weight that makes it comfortable to hold and use., "Charge time is about average (maybe a little longer than some of the pricier brands) and it holds its charge for a long period of time. He doesnt need to charge it very often between usage.", The storage bag helps keep all of the attachments together. Sure beats throwing them in a drawer and having them get lost in all of the bathroom junk being stored in there. :), The quality of this product is unbeatable for the price. Great value, great product!

And I also like the handle in this grooming tool, because it has a secure grip even when wet, and the built-in Lithium Ion rechargeable battery is long-lasting, and it can be recharged from any USB port. A USB charging cable with wall charger, and a storage bag are also included.

Review text: "I mainly used this for beard, mustache, arm pits, and groin. Arm pits and groin you can use without the comb. For beard it worked amazing because you can store up to the four lengths and recall them as needed. I use a #3 and #4 guard for my beard which equates to approximately 9mm and 12mm respectively. I would recall those settings and just set it back to 1mm when I was done so it didnt try to spool up the motor to a raised height if I was using it without the comb. The blades cut well and stay sharp even with my coarse beard hair. I only had to drop a little trimmer blade oil on the blades themselves after a good cleaning around the year mark and I put one drop each in the gear slots where the guides for the comb are to lubricate the guide motors. I only did this because I noticed the comb was rattling a bit after the 8-9 month mark and the blades would get a little hot after extended use. The trimmer blade oil cleared up both. 2-3 drops on the blade and let it run for 15-20 secs while working it around the blades and 1 drop in each comb motor guide and run it up and down (about 9-12mm each time) a few times. Worked like it was brand new out of the box again.", The only reason I\m buying a new one is it got used (by someone that wasn\t me) and was allowed to get very wet under running water while the trimmer was running. Water got inside the trimmer while running and now the LED screen is messed up (I\ve seen other videos depicting the LED screen issue and they say it "happened randomly after a year or so". I\d be willing to bet it was due to getting very wet while in operation). This won\t deter me from buying another one because it\s THAT GOOD! The instructions explicitly state that while it can be put through running water to be cleaned it should only be done with the trimmer OFF and locked to avoid damage to the electronics., I would easily pay an extra $20-40 if there was an IP rated version of this trimmer with the same features. *Looking at you, Remington*

Review text:
This is a standard facial hair trimmer with electronic complications.  

It charges fast by USB or with the including wall adapter and battery life is good.  

It is waterproof but the touch-sensitive panels interfere with a secure grip, especially with wet hands.  

The "Auto Turbo" adjustment for hair thickness works well and the memory will be helpful for some but overall the extra features add bulk and expense and complicate what should be a simple device.

Review text:
The variable speed motor is a nice feature as well;  the speed adjusts to the thickness of your beard.  

Because I travel a lot, one feature I especially love is the lock switch, which prevents the trimmer from being accidentally started when jostled around in your luggage  -  this has happened to me on more than one occasion with other rechargeable trimmers, and its a bummer when it does.  

Lastly, its easy to clean.  

Highly recommended."

Review text:
The 0.1 mm increments in length are overkill (0.5 would have been more than enough) but the fact that you can quickly adjust is very nice.

I shave my beard pretty short (2.5 mm) and my sideburns much longer (8 mm).

With the Norelco, I shaved my sideburns once a week because of the added inconvenience of the second attachment.

The Norelco uses a specific barrel connector to charge, while this uses a standard USB micro charger - much more convenient!

Review text:
This is a standard facial hair trimmer with electronic complications.  

It charges fast by USB or with the including wall adapter and battery life is good.  

It is waterproof but the touch-sensitive panels interfere with a secure grip, especially with wet hands.  

The "Auto Turbo" adjustment for hair thickness works well and the memory will be helpful for some but overall the extra features add bulk and expense and complicate what should be a simple device.

Review text: I have to be honest, I thought the electronic control was yet another gimmick to make something "smart" that didn't need it. My previous trimmer, a different brand, did everything this one does, but with manual height adjustment. HOWEVER, this feature gets you fantastic adjustment capability and the memory lets you come back to different settings easily. This will accommodate a wide variety of beard, like no other. When I look at the wide range of beards, aside from just mine, this crazy amount of adjustability is a nice feature, "Before I get started with trimming, I always have to check the height and I found this ones 4 MM is the others 3 MM. Once you have the numbers dialed in (start high and dial down), its a great trimmer. I like the trimmer itself better than my other, it feels like I need fewer passes to get the right trim. The speed of the blade is a bit higher which helps. The comb is a little sharper than my other, which requires a lighter touch to avoid irritation. Still, it does great.", I also think the automatic speed control, which adjusts to your beard itself, is another reason for a better trim. Being fully washable is a really big plus too., "Charging off a USB connector rather than a dedicated charger is a cool feature too, for that occasional charge on travel when you forget to top off before your trip. Battery life is as promised, and it shows you when it needs to be recharged, its hard to miss.", All-in-all, a very nice trimmer with a lot of flexibility and good battery life.

"I mainly used this for beard, mustache, arm pits, and groin.

Arm pits and groin you can use without the comb.

For beard it worked amazing because you can store up to the four lengths and recall them as needed.

I use a #3 and #4 guard for my beard which equates to approximately 9mm and 12mm respectively.

Review text: "  Over years now Ive used a few different beard trimmers and I can see how the product design has changed.  This one has many features that older trimmers didnt have.  The ability to wash the cutters is a big plus.  Cord/cordless is also a good option to have.  The wide and detailed adjustment range with the ability to set some memorized positions is handy.  The battery charge indicator is helpful.  Auto turbo is pretty advanced, but I think Im happier with just a regular on/off turbo setting.  Touch screen is easy to read and use.  I really like the compact carry bag provided with the trimmer.  Im a little surprised the same markings that show battery status are used for memorized settings, and I dont especially like that design choice.  Overall, this is a state of the art trimmer and I expect it to last a long time."

Review text: "  I picked one of these up just to keep a 5 oclock shadow as my wife/kids were not digging the full beard look.  Lots of choices out there, but I chose Remington because of a very good experience with them.  I also have their vacuum trimmer which works quite well as a body hair trimmer.  After 2 years the vacuum trimmer stopped charging, I emailed Remington and the very next day, no questions asked, they mailed me a brand new vacuum trimmer.  They didnt ask for the old one back or even ask for proof that I disposed of it, which would have been reasonable.  In this day and age where companies seem to disappear the minute you have issues with a product I was extremely impressed with Remingtons customer service.", "Anyway back to this trimmer, I really like the memory feature so its always on 0.8 and I dont have to adjust anything.  The cutting itself is great, but you have to make sure the head is completely flat which is a bit of a challenge on the jaw angles.  You do have to have multiple passes with this one, Id say several passes in both grain directions, but this is quick and a full shave takes me maybe 5-10 minutes at the most.  It cuts very evenly as long as you keep the head flat and the battery easily lasts as long as I need it to.  It even cuts unevenly if thats what you want, sometimes I want my chin/lip to be a bit longer than my jaw and its adjustable enough to accomplish this and blend it well.", "The only wishlist request is a way to handle side burns as you cant get a nice line separating them from your beard without actually cutting the beard all the way right under the sideburn. Without the comb guide the cut is good, but if you want a nice sharp line I would recommend getting a T-outliner ($20 from Amazon) for that crisp defined line.

The only downfall is when you set it down for just a few seconds it turns off and when you slightly move it, it turns back on so I use the lock on the side for storage.

Ive used many different trimmers.

Much better than those cheap light weight trimmers with all the attachments.

The battery didn’t last long, and the blades became dull quickly.

, I ordered this with the intention of replacing my “daily driver” and using that Norelco as my dedicated travel trimmer.,

Compared to the Norelco, I like that this trimmer has much more granular adjustments of length, and that I don’t need to hunt for the attachments.

The 0.1 mm increments in length are overkill (0.5 would have been more than enough) but the fact that you can quickly adjust is very nice.

Review text: I have to be honest, I thought the electronic control was yet another gimmick to make something "smart" that didn't need it. My previous trimmer, a different brand, did everything this one does, but with manual height adjustment. HOWEVER, this feature gets you fantastic adjustment capability and the memory lets you come back to different settings easily. This will accommodate a wide variety of beard, like no other. When I look at the wide range of beards, aside from just mine, this crazy amount of adjustability is a nice feature, "Before I get started with trimming, I always have to check the height and I found this ones 4 MM is the others 3 MM. Once you have the numbers dialed in (start high and dial down), its a great trimmer. I like the trimmer itself better than my other, it feels like I need fewer passes to get the right trim. The speed of the blade is a bit higher which helps. The comb is a little sharper than my other, which requires a lighter touch to avoid irritation. Still, it does great.", I also think the automatic speed control, which adjusts to your beard itself, is another reason for a better trim. Being fully washable is a really big plus too., "Charging off a USB connector rather than a dedicated charger is a cool feature too, for that occasional charge on travel when you forget to top off before your trip. Battery life is as promised, and it shows you when it needs to be recharged, its hard to miss.", All-in-all, a very nice trimmer with a lot of flexibility and good battery life.

Review text:
I was surprised by this little trimmer set.

I have been using this for couple weeks now and haven’t had to charge it yet.

Battery life is a huge deal breaker these days and this doesn’t disappoint.

The attachments are nice and have a sturdy heaviness to the metal giving it a quality feel.

The blades have been cutting without any hair snags so it’s not as cheap as my last set.

The trimmer fits nice in my hand and easy to use with both hands.
